alert.note: Alert for Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 5:58PM CST until February 23 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW TAPERS OFF AND HAZARDOUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING... .Snow continues to exit the region, and another round of Arctic air will settle in behind the storm system overnight. Wind chills of 25 to 35 below zero are forecast tonight as the cold air moves in. The best chance for the colder part of this range will be over western Minnesota where the winds will remain higher. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow will continue this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Yellow Medicine County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
